page.title: 01EAST MEON
page.content: The area contains an ancient hill fort (Old Winchester Hill) and nature reserve. The land between the above and the village is agricultural,mainly open farming land. Crops grown are wheat,barley,oats and oil seed rape. The animals kept are sheep,cows and pigs. The village dates back to Norman time. The main features are the beautiful Church and the Court House. The Meon river runs through the High Street. On both sides a variety of buildings can be seen from Tudor to modern times. On the fringe of the village, the housing is mainly modern 20th century and council owned. The school is twenty years old and set in its own grounds which includes a swimming pool and football field.
